course.subject: CORE
course.name: Academic English for University Studies
course.description: This course emphasises the development of academic literacy skills, in addition to developing studentsâ€™ language proficiency.Students will learn how to find and evaluate sources for academic tasks and will further develop their abilities to be critical in reading and writing, to synthesise ideas and to develop coherent arguments. Collaboration and leadership skills will also be emphasised to further develop skills and habits for autonomous lifelong learning.
course.prerequisites: CORE 1401 OR CORE 1402 OR Level 5 in HKDSE English Language with all papers at or above level 4 OR Overall bandscore of 6.5 in IELTS with all subscores at or above 6.0 OR equivalence of the above

reviews.author: Drater
reviews.title: A major waste of time and CGA
reviews.comment_content:
Unit 1 - Professionalism: Team skills and research skills
- Content: This helps develop skills that will be useful for the rest of the course and your future studies.
- Format: Twice a week F2FD.

Unit 2 - Academic literacy skills for university study
- Content: Writing a summary and critique; finding, evaluating, synthesizing and citing sources; producing coherent arguments; and helping the audience follow and engage with your ideas.
- Assessment: Submit 1 main assessment: W2 (individual writing)
- Format: A combination of F2F lessons and self-directed lessons. The self-directed lessons involve SDL activities at home instead of attending F2F class.
- You also work on your first SDL elective in your own time through this unit.

Unit 3 -
- Content: Communicating coherently and effectively in an informative and engaging way for your audience.
- Assessment: Submit 1 main assessment: W2 (individual video)
- Format: A combination of F2F lessons and self-directed lessons. The self-directed lessons involve SDL activities at home instead of attending F2F class.
- You also work on your second SDL elective in your own time through this unit.

Explanation:
Project tasks (75%) = 1 writing (W2) + 1 individual video (V2) which make up your main course project.
SDL (25%) = small, regular online self-directed tasks throughout Unit 2 and 3 AND the Online Library Session to complete at home.
Self-directed lessons = non regular F2F classes. Instead, complete the online work in your own time at home.
reviews.comment_teaching: The majority of the lessons are pretty boring, half the time I'm unsure what to do, half the time my group mates are very "clever" in which I am unable to communicate with them properly.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is really messed up since the entire course is graded onto a curve, not exactly sure if it is graded with other sessions (i.e. CORE1403I, CORE1403A), but whatever it is, the C-range is as wide as the entire galaxy, not in a good way. Oh and different instructors give different grades depending on their moods and what not, so better get a good grading one or else you're... boned.
reviews.comment_workload: When it's midway through the semester, everything seems normal; when it's almost midterm, this course slaps you with the first writing assignment, which sucks alone; then finally, when it's finals, you get demotivated from video assignment because it's literally finals, and it will also take you a ton of time and effort to actually get a "decent" grade.

reviews.author: Leoml
reviews.comment_content: See other reviews. Some of the contents are really useful, such as websites for finding collocations and good source of blogs, but most are not. The materials covered in tutorials are just too simple intuitions that can be easily observed by most people. All of them can hardly be applied to the writing and speaking tasks without intense practice, which can hardly be provided for a 3-credit course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Although the instructor is nice and willing to give you advice and feedback, the effectiveness of teaching is really poor in room numbered 21xx. Everybody faces the screen in these rooms, not the others. In my class, nearly no one speaks and it is impossible to interact for introverts like me.
reviews.comment_grading: The scheme doesnâ€™t matter anyways. It just heavily depends on your speaking and language skills, but not whether you are hard working or not. With average writing skills and above average speaking and presentation skills, I got a B.
reviews.comment_workload: Intense. As I am not specialised in video making, I find it difficult to even implement a single animation, but you have to make a 6-minute video. The requirements for multimodality should be reduced to suit more students.

reviews.author: ShinySunny
reviews.comment_content: The content is fine, as boring as 1402. But one should not have high expectations for English class lol.
reviews.comment_teaching:
A very good teacher.
The teaching is a bit boring, like all other language courses. Elza will involve many random presentations and group work in class, where you discuss with your group mates and choose one person to present in front of the class. Doing this kind of presentation can boost your oral English.
I really make some friends in this course.
She is very kind and willing to help you with your essay after class.  She provides detailed materials to improve our writing skills, but these exercises are completely voluntary. The teaching method is a bit like high school English class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good
Got all advance/exceptional for all criteria
Final grade: A
I expect to get an A+ but it seems that the highest grade for 1403s is only A, so it's fine.
reviews.comment_workload:
As both the essay and video account for 40% of the final grade, I spent quite a lot of time finishing them. Making a video is very challenging for me.
I ask Elza for advice and she is very helpful.
When there is no assessment to finish, you only need to attend classes and the workload is very light.
The overall workload is not really heavy.

reviews.author: tianyu
reviews.comment_content: The content is really useless. The academic blog and video are meaningless. Just throwing your work to GPT is enough.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite nice and you can even speak Cantonese in his class.
But he is never gonna let you appeal since he thinks he is fair enough ( and it is true considering the A grade).
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is surprisingly good. Me and most of my friends got an A.
I think this time the grading depends on your performance among others with the same professor.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload. You can just skip the lectures and do each SDL within 3min (GPT can let you finish all within 30sec). The W2 and V2 only need 2 days to finish each to get an advanced and above.
